oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effects of the 6VS.6AL translocation on agronomic traits and dough properties of wheat
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Guiping Li
Peidu Chen
Shouzhong Zhang
Xiue Wang
He Zhonghu
Yan Zhang
He Zhao
Huiyao Huang
Xiangchun Zhou
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Grain yield
Pm21
powdery mildew
Triticum aestivum L
Wide crosses
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nineteen common wheat cultivars and advanced lines carrying a 6VS.6AL translocation and five parents were sown at two locations in Jiangsu in 2004–05 season to assess the effects of the translocation on grain yield and dough properties. In general, there were no significant differences between 6VS.6AL lines and their recurrent parents in agronomic, mixograph and starch pasting traits, including grain yield, grains/spike, grain weight/spike, mixing time and peak viscosity. 6VS.6AL lines showed slightly but significantly higher thousand-kernel weight and plant height, and small negative effects on test weight, flour yield and flour colour. However, significant variation occurred for all traits among sister lines from the same cross, indicating that additional selection could lead to further improvement. It was concluded that the 6VS.6AL translocation can be used in wheat breeding programs as a donor of resistance to powdery mildew with no obvious undesirable effects on agronomic and quality traits.
